snippet: The pervasive presence of government in French life, from workplace rules to health and education benefits, is now the subject of a great debate.
abstract: French people are debating the pervasive presence of government in their lives, from workplace rules to health and education benefits; nation is grappling with whether it can sustain post World War II-model of social democracy; spiraling costs of cradle-to-grave social welfare programs have all but exhausted the government's ability to raise taxes necessary to pay for it all.
lead_paragraph: The pervasive presence of government in French life, from workplace rules to health and education benefits, is now the subject of a great debate.

headline.main: Under Strain, France Examines Its Safety Net
headline.print_headline: Under Strain, France Examines Its Safety Net
